dateline.placeName: BostonCD returned to Boston 31 March-10 April.

body.p: Two considerations in reference to Thursday:––CD’s final reading in Boston was to be Wednesday, 7 April; he clearly intended to spend Thursday on farewells.
1. I am so nervous and shaken, that I should be in danger of tumbling to pieces, if I tried to sit behind your fast trotting horse
2. I must have a carriage on that day, to go about and leave some cards.

Question therefore respectfully submitted:—whether visit to Mrs. TicknorWife of H. M. Ticknor; she died 1927. in gorgeous equipage turned out under Parkerian contractI.e. a carriage hired from the Parker House Hotel, Boston. be admissible as compromise and at what hour?
